stem: The registered nurse (RN) is planning care for a client in soft wrist restraints for medical protection. Based on the documentation, match each task with the appropriate nursing professional.

tabs.title: Nurses' Notes
tabs.content:
Patient: (Mr. Adams, 70 years old). Currently in soft wrist restraints to prevent removal of a nasogastric tube.
RN Goal: Ensure safe delegation while maintaining legal accountability.

tabs.title: Nursing Action Assignment Log
tabs.content:
Action ItemGoalAccountability
Assessment of skin colorIdentify injuryRN Only
ROM ExercisesPrevent stiffnessCan be delegated
Vital SignsBaseline checkCan be delegated
Initial Restraint ApplicationFirst setupRN or LPN (under RN)

tabs.title: Delegation Standard
tabs.content: RNs may NOT delegate: T-E-A-C-H (Teaching, Evaluation, Assessment, Case Management, High-risk meds).

rows.text: Performing the initial neurovascular assessment and skin integrity check.
Repositioning the client and providing range-of-motion (ROM) exercises.
Measuring vital signs during the 15-minute check-in.
Evaluating the continued need for restraints and documenting the assessment.

rationale.correct: The RN (c1) must perform all assessments (r1) and evaluations of medical necessity (r4). Routine tasks like repositioning/ROM (r2) and basic vital sign collection (r3) can be delegated to the UAP (c2).
clinicalPearls: The UAP can RE-APPLY a restraint (e.g., after toileting) in some facilities, but the RN MUST assess it immediately after.
LPNs can often collect data but cannot perform the 'Initial' or 'Admission' assessment.
The RN is always responsible for the outcome, regardless of who did the task.

questionTrap.trap: Delegating the 'check for pulse' to a UAP.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: A 'check' is an assessment. If it requires nursing judgment (Normal vs. Weak), it belongs to the RN.

mnemonic.title: Don't Delegate T-E-A-C-H
mnemonic.expansion: Teaching, Evaluation, Assessment, Case Management, High-risk meds.
